name: T - Guards Talk
_source: speak;Emma; Do I want to spend the evening with Sonia, Marica, and Lily?
speak;Emma; They look deep in thought...{w} I should leave them be tonight.
speak;Emma; Man, the stars are so beautiful tonight.{w} It just blows my mind, how pretty the night sky can look.
speak;Sonia; You can say that again!{w} I'll never get tired of looking at it!
speak;Lily; You know, those stars tell their own stories.{w} You can learn a lot from them.
speak;Sonia; Hm? Stories?{w} How do you get those from some lights in the sky?
speak;Lily; I don't mean that the lights are just there to weave fiction.{w} Emma, do you remember when I taught you about them?
speak;Emma; They tell the future too, right?

speak;Lily; Yeah, that's the other half of it.{w} Older civilizations used to think that the stars were their gods' way of communicating.{w} That's how both divination and storytelling from the stars became commonplace.
speak;Marica; That's quite the history lesson, but when am I ever going to use this knowledge?{w} School is long behind me.
speak;Lily; The strongest and hardest of documented dark magics supposedly draw power from the stars.
speak;Marica; Doesn't seem to matter to me{tgm}...{tgm}{w} I'm not exactly a dark magic fanatic.
speak;Sonia; You know, my mother told me about the stars when I was little.{w} She said they were put in the sky so we could always find our way.
speak;Marica; My father told me the stars were in the sky so the moon wouldn't get lonely.
speak;Sonia; Emma, why do you think the stars exist?

speak;Emma; Well, Mom never told me why, but{tgm}...{tgm}{w} I think I'm satisfied with thinking that the stars are just there to be pretty.{w} Hah, I can almost hear Emily nagging at how childish that sounds{tgm}...
speak;Sonia; Ha! What's the shame in being a little simple.
speak;Sonia; Why, if everyone were so straightforward, the world might be a better place.
speak;Lily; Ah, it seems we have a self- proclaimed idealist on our hands.
speak;Sonia; Well, someone here has to counter Caroline's nihilism.
speak;Emma; I think Sonia has a point, though.{w} Maybe the world could stand to be simpler.
speak;Sonia; Bah, that's enough of this talk.{w} Save that for our walk tomorrow.{w} Tonight, we relax under the stars.
speak;Lily;I suppose with company as pleasant as us, what more could you ask for?
speak;Emma; What more could you really ask for?
